A sampling bowl of red and white balls

Source: R/bowl.R

A sampling bowl used as the population in a simulated sampling exercise. Also known as the urn sampling framework https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Urn_problem.

bowl

Format

A data frame 2400 rows representing different balls in the bowl, of which 900 are red and 1500 are white.

ball_ID

ID variable used to denote all balls. Note this value is not marked on the balls themselves

color

color of ball: red or white

Examples

library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)

# Take 10 different samples of size n = 50 balls from bowl
bowl_samples_simulated <- bowl %>%
  rep_sample_n(50, reps = 10)

# Compute 10 different p_hats (prop red) based on 10 different samples of
# size n = 50
p_hats <- bowl_samples_simulated %>%
  group_by(replicate, color) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  mutate(proportion = count/50) %>%
  filter(color == "red")

# Plot sampling distribution
ggplot(p_hats, aes(x = proportion)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.05) +
  labs(x = expression(hat(p)), y = "Number of samples",
  title = "Sampling distribution of p_hat based 10 samples of size n = 50")
